messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:26): tries to hack together a font subsetter
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:27): When used for a dozen ASCII letters, a font like Gentium goes from 260KB to 25KB, of which 13KB is the licence text
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:29): and annevk's big-noodle-titling goes from 26KB to 8KB, of which 4KB is the licence text
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:30): (I've probably got lots of bugs that break kerning and everything, though)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: all browsers that support @font-face support gzip, don't they?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: wouldn't it be safe to serve a gzipped font unconditionally without conneg?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:35): presumably that would take care of the license text
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:36): With gzip, it's 3.5KB for big-noodle-titling and 11KB for Gentium
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:38): I want to try how hard it will be to use Linux Libertine, MgOpen Cosmetica and Libertine Mono with @font-face with strict license compliance
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:39): i.e. providing full corresponding source code
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:40): Removing the copyright text and using gzip, it's 2.7KB and 7KB respectively
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:41): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: does Gentium allow the removal of the license text and replacing it with the URL of the license?
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (21:41): what constitutes source code in the case of fonts?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:41): http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/render_download.php?site_id=nrsi&format=file&media_id=OFL_plaintext&filename=OFL.txt
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:42): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f: the preferred form for making modification, which is the FontForge input file

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:42): "Original or Modified Versions of the Font Software may be bundled, redistributed and/or sold with any software, provided that each copy contains the above copyright notice and this license. These can be included either as stand-alone text files, human-readable headers or in the appropriate machine-readable metadata fields within text or binary files as long as those fields can be easily viewed by the user."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:43): someone should make a font serving site that crawls the customer sites and subsets fonts automatically
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: do you mean that it would subset it to include characters found in the text that uses the font?

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:46): or a comment form

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:47): I was idealistically unrealistically thinking of making something vaguely like that
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:48): would be happy if he could choose which characters to include from a character map or pasting the characters he wanted
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (21:49): e.g. if i wanted to use a webfont for my mother's site's headings i'd want swedish and icelandic characters
